definition: the Band-tightening Spell (in 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4])/a spell or incantation for controlling sb
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
incantation/magic spell/curse/malediction/to revile/to put a curse on sb

sentences.english: I am thankful to have broken a spell.
sentences.chinese: 謝天謝地，我已經打破了一個緊箍咒。

sentences.english: Ann: Yes, the Nobel Peace Prize is an inhibiting magic phrase.
sentences.chinese: 對啊，諾貝爾和平獎就是緊箍咒。

sentences.english: It is interesting. It seems that it's Tripitaka's Curse.
sentences.chinese: 真有趣，聽起來就像是三藏的緊箍咒。

definition: lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
to uphold virtue and condemn evil (idiom)
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
lit. four ounces can move a thousand catties (idiom)/fig. to achieve much with little effort
to take a lot of trouble (idiom); painstaking/at the cost of a lot of effort
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
